p: The difference in clinical manifestations between A/H1N1pdm09 and A/H3N2 is very important in the clinical setting. For example, in young adults with H1N1pdm09, severe viral pneumonia sometimes develops as a complication [ 12], while elderly patients with A/H3N2 often develop bacterial pneumonia. Thus, it is highly beneficial for clinicians to distinguish between influenza A subtypes when they considering the treatment and prognosis of influenza A patients.
